channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Democrat Mikie Sherrill wins New Jersey governor's race
item.description: Democratic Rep. Mikie Sherrill won the race for New Jersey governor late Tuesday, beating back a challenge from Republican Jack Ciattarelli in a race ...

item.title: The results are in: 2025's biggest winner and losers from the off-year elections
item.description: The 2025 election cycle delivered Democratic victories in Virginia and New Jersey gubernatorial races while Republicans failed to gain ground in key s...

item.title: Pennsylvania Votes Yes To Another Decade Of Leftist Supreme Court Activism
item.description: Big money was spent on advertising to retain the justices, promoting keeping them on the bench to 'protect' abortion access.

item.title: OpenAI’s new safety tools are designed to make AI models harder to jailbreak. Instead, they may give users a false sense of security.
item.description: OpenAI has open-sourced two AI safety classifiers that let enterprises more easily set their own guardrails. Experts say the move could improve transp...

item.title: Texas Democrats Menefee and Edwards advance to runoff for vacant U.S. House seat
item.description: Democrats Christian Menefee and Amanda Edwards advanced to a runoff Tuesday night in a special election for a U.S. House seat that has been vacant sin...

item.title: Dems’ Election Day Sweep Is Not A Harbinger, It’s A Wake-Up Call For The Grand Old Party
item.description: Congressional Republicans need to do something worthy of voter support, and the party has to sharpen its early-voting ground game..

item.title: GOP lawmakers rally behind Trump's Venezuela strikes as critics question legality
item.description: The U.N. condemns Trump’s Venezuela strikes as violations of international law as U.S. lawmakers clash over sovereignty and global legal standards.

item.title: Palantir says college is no longer a reliable training ground—so it hired 22 high school students instead: ‘Skip the debt. Skip the indoctrination.’
item.description: 22 Gen Zers are currently graduating from Palantir’s Meritocracy Fellowship, as CEO Alex Karp calls his company "the best credential in tech."

item.title: Behind Democrats’ Sob Stories Is A Push For More Tax Dollars To Insurance Companies
item.description: It's not a debate about lowering insurance costs. It's about how much of our tax dollars the government will give to private corporations.

item.title: Trump compares Dems to kamikaze pilots: 'They'll take down the country if they have to'
item.description: The longest government shutdown in U.S. history reaches 36 days as Republicans and Democrats remain deadlocked over healthcare provisions in funding b...

item.title: J.D. Vance's half-brother loses in race for Cincinnati mayor
item.description: Vice President J.D. Vance's half-brother, Cory Bowman, lost in the race for mayor of Cincinnati against incumbent Democrat Aftab Pureval.

item.title: As NYC elects socialist Mamdani, neighboring county doubles down on Trump-style leadership with Blakeman’s win
item.description: Nassau County re-elects Trump-backed executive Bruce Blakeman while New York City chooses socialist Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani, amid stark political d...

item.title: Mamdani's win in New York propels Democratic Party toward socialism
item.description: America's biggest city is about to be thrust into a socialist government, and, to the chagrin of many Democrats, the rest of the country will be watch...

item.title: Corporate America is trying to tell us something about the economy, top analyst says: a 3-year recession for ‘much of the private economy’ ended in April
item.description: Morgan Stanley's Mike Wilson was a lonely voice on Wall Street calling a "rolling recession" when others saw a boom. Now he sees a "rolling recovery."

item.title: The Lawfare Menace
item.description: When the rule of law erodes, so does liberty.

item.title: Chester County Poll Book Fiasco Highlights PA’s Election Integrity Issues
item.description: Election watchers were outraged over the inconvenience to voters and the election integrity weaknesses this situation has created.

item.title: RFK Jr.’s Cherry-Picked Science
item.description: What the HHS secretary is doing could jeopardize, not help, public health.

item.title: Meet Mira Nair, Zohran Mamdani’s 68-year-old mother who hit it big in Hollywood directing critical darlings like ‘Monsoon Wedding’
item.description: Nair is the first woman director to win the Venice Film Festival's top prize, and famously turned down WB's offer to direct the fourth Harry Potter mo...

item.title: What Zohran Mamdani’s Policies Will Do to New York
item.description: The mayor-elect has a terrible proposal for just about every problem the city faces.

item.title: California voters approve new congressional map to boost Democrats in 2026
item.description: California voters approved new congressional district boundaries Tuesday, delivering a victory for Democrats in the state-by-state redistricting battl...

item.title: A Big Democratic Night
item.description: No amount of gerrymandering will be able to withstand this kind of Democratic surge if it materializes again in a year’s time.

item.title: The Alternative Facts of Rob Reiner
item.description: This Is Spinal Tap ’s backward showbiz parody predicts Hollywood liberalism on the wrong side of culture and history.

item.title: KPMG’s new CEO joined as an intern 33 years ago. Now he wants to lure Gen Z back with a new office outfitted with moody lounges and a barista bar
item.description: KPMG is shrinking its New York footprint by 40% and betting on design—not mandates—to bring employees back to the office.

item.title: Democrats Want Republicans To Bail Them Out Of Their Bad Political Gamble
item.description: By punting the issue into 2025, Democrats hoped they could secure a permanent extension of Obamacare subsidies. That plan backfired.

item.title: GOP urges Democrat governor to deploy National Guard to Charlotte as crime surges
item.description: Three North Carolina Republican lawmakers urge Democratic Gov. Josh Stein to deploy National Guard in Charlotte amid rising crime rates and homicides.
